prompt:
I want you to solve planning problems. Here is the domain PDDL file: 
 (define (domain blocksworld-4ops)
  (:requirements :strips)
(:predicates (clear ?x)
             (on-table ?x)
             (arm-empty)
             (holding ?x)
             (on ?x ?y))

(:action pickup
  :parameters (?ob)
  :precondition (and (clear ?ob) (on-table ?ob) (arm-empty))
  :effect (and (holding ?ob) (not (clear ?ob)) (not (on-table ?ob)) 
               (not (arm-empty))))

(:action putdown
  :parameters  (?ob)
  :precondition (holding ?ob)
  :effect (and (clear ?ob) (arm-empty) (on-table ?ob) 
               (not (holding ?ob))))

(:action stack
  :parameters  (?ob ?underob)
  :precondition (and (clear ?underob) (holding ?ob))
  :effect (and (arm-empty) (clear ?ob) (on ?ob ?underob)
               (not (clear ?underob)) (not (holding ?ob))))

(:action unstack
  :parameters  (?ob ?underob)
  :precondition (and (on ?ob ?underob) (clear ?ob) (arm-empty))
  :effect (and (holding ?ob) (clear ?underob)
               (not (on ?ob ?underob)) (not (clear ?ob)) (not (arm-empty))))) 
An example planning problem is: 
 You have 5 blocks. 
b2 is on top of b5. 
b5 is on top of b1. 
b1 is on top of b4. 
b3 is on top of b2. 
b4 is on the table. 
b3 is clear. 
Your arm is empty. 
Your goal is to move the blocks. 
b4 should be on top of b3. 
The problem PDDL file to this problem is: 
 (define (problem BW-rand-5)
(:domain blocksworld-4ops)
(:objects b1 b2 b3 b4 b5 )
(:init
(arm-empty)
(on b1 b4)
(on b2 b5)
(on b3 b2)
(on-table b4)
(on b5 b1)
(clear b3)
)
(:goal
(and
(on b4 b3))
)
) 
Now I have a new planning problem and its description is: 
 You have 12 blocks. 
b4 is on top of b10. 
b11 is on top of b4. 
b5 is on top of b8. 
b12 is on top of b2. 
b3 is on top of b9. 
b1 is on top of b12. 
b10 is on top of b3. 
b9 is on top of b1. 
b7 is on the table. 
b2 is on the table. 
b6 is on the table. 
b8 is on the table. 
b6 is clear. 
b11 is clear. 
b7 is clear. 
b5 is clear. 
Your arm is empty. 
Your goal is to move the blocks. 
b1 should be on top of b6. 
b5 should be on top of b3. 
b6 should be on top of b2. 
b8 should be on top of b9. 
b9 should be on top of b10. 
b10 should be on top of b1. 
b11 should be on top of b12. 
b12 should be on top of b8. 
Provide me with BOTH a domain PDDL file AND a problem PDDL file that describes the new planning problem. Format your response as follows:
DOMAIN:
[domain PDDL content]

PROBLEM:
[problem PDDL content]

Make sure both files use consistent naming and types. Do not provide any other explanations.

DOMAIN:
```
(define (domain blocksworld-12blocks)
  (:requirements :strips)
  (:predicates (clear ?x)
             (on-table ?x)
             (arm-empty)
             (holding ?x)
             (on ?x ?y))

  (:action pickup
    :parameters (?ob)
    :precondition (and (clear ?ob) (on-table ?ob) (arm-empty))
    :effect (and (holding ?ob) (not (clear ?ob)) (not (on-table ?ob)) 
                 (not (arm-empty))))

  (:action putdown
    :parameters (?ob)
    :precondition (holding ?ob)
    :effect (and (clear ?ob) (arm-empty) (on-table ?ob) 
                 (not (holding ?ob))))

  (:action stack
    :parameters (?ob ?underob)
    :precondition (and (clear ?underob) (holding ?ob))
    :effect (and (arm-empty) (clear ?ob) (on ?ob ?underob)
                 (not (clear ?underob)) (not (holding ?ob))))

  (:action unstack
    :parameters (?ob ?underob)
    :precondition (and (on ?ob ?underob) (clear ?ob) (arm-empty))
    :effect (and (holding ?ob) (clear ?underob)
                 (not (on ?ob ?underob)) (not (clear ?ob)) (not (arm-empty))))
)
```

(on b4 b10)
(on b11 b4)
(on b5 b8)
(on b12 b2)
(on b3 b9)
(on b1 b12)
(on b10 b3)
(on b9 b1)
(on-table b7)
(on-table b2)
(on-table b6)
(on-table b8)
(clear b6)
(clear b11)
(clear b7)
(clear b5)
)
(:goal
(and
(on b1 b6)
(on b5 b3)
(on b6 b2)
(on b8 b9)
(on b9 b10)
(on b10 b1)
(on b11 b12)
(on b12 b8)
)
)
